tutorial.title: Creating a CSS Grid
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to use CSS grids to group elements on a webpage into columns

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
CSS Grid is a layout system that lets us add items both horizontally and vertically on a webpage.

That's different from Flexbox, where we could only place items in one dimension at a time. Press the buttons to see the differences.

lessons.title: Grid Container
lessons.interactiveContent:
To use CSS Grid, we first have to create a parent element that acts as a container.

Make sure to pick class, followed by =, and finally "grid-container".

lessons.title: Grid Items
lessons.interactiveContent:
Next, we add the grid-item class to elements inside the container.

Make sure to pick class followed by = and then ", grid-item, ".

lessons.title: Display Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
To apply CSS Grid to the container, we need to start with the display property.

Make sure to pick display.

lessons.title: Display Property Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then set the container's display property to the value grid.

Make sure to pick grid.

lessons.title: Columns Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Next, we'll want to organize grid items into columns. To do that we'll use the grid-template-columns property.

Make sure to pick grid followed by - and then template, -, columns.

lessons.title: Columns Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can then set the size of each column separately depending on our design. Here, set the size of the columns to 50px 50px 120px.

Make sure to pick 50px, followed by 50px, and finally 120px.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Container
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which element do we set as the grid container?

The parent elementThe child element

The parent element.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Items
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

The grid item should be inside the grid containerThere should be more grid containers

The grid item should be inside the grid container.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property should we use to transform an element into a grid container?

The display propertyThe grid-template-columns property

The display property.

lessons.title: Question: Grid Property Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which display property value do we use when creating a grid?

We use the grid valueWe use the flex value

We use the grid value.

lessons.title: Question: Columns Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property do we use to define grid columns?

grid-template-columnsdisplay

Make sure to pick grid-template-columns.

lessons.title: Question: Columns Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid columns will be created when we use the CSS declaration grid-template-columns: 40px 60px?

TwoThree

Make sure to pick Two.

lessons.title: Example: Grid Container
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a class attribute and assign the value grid-container.

Make sure to pick class followed by = and then ", grid, -, container, ".

lessons.title: Example: Grid Items
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add another grid item inside the container.

Make sure to pick < followed by div and then class="grid-item", >, 6, </, div, >.

lessons.title: Example: Grid Property Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the value grid to turn the container into a CSS Grid.

Make sure to type grid.

lessons.title: Example: Columns Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code grid-template-columns to create grid columns.

Make sure to type grid-template-columns.

lessons.title: Example: Columns Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create two fixed columns by setting grid-template-columns to 130px 130px.

Make sure to type 130px 130px.
